GetXMasterFirebaseLoginSocialFacebook Sn.description: Before getting started setup your Facebook Developer App and follow the setup process to enable Facebook Login.Ensure the Facebook sign-in provider is enabled on the Firebase Console. with the Facebook App ID and Secret set.

body: /// Generates a cryptographically secure random nonce, to be included in a
/// Returns the sha256 hash of [input] in hex notation.
// To prevent replay attacks with the credential returned from Apple, we
// include a nonce in the credential request. When signing in in with
// Firebase, the nonce in the id token returned by Apple, is expected to
// Request credential for the currently signed in Apple account.
// Create an `OAuthCredential` from the credential returned by Apple.
// Sign in the user with Firebase. If the nonce we generated earlier does
// not match the nonce in `appleCredential.identityToken`, sign in will fail.

GetXMasterFirebaseSignOut Snippet.description: To sign a user out, call the signOut() method, if you are listening to changes in authentication state, a new event will be sent to your listeners.

GetXMasterFirebaseAnonymousLogin Snippet.description: To get started, call the signInAnonymously() method on the FirebaseAuth instance

GetXMasterFirebaseAuthState Snippet.description: To subscribe to these changes, call the authStateChanges() method on your FirebaseAuth instance

GetXMasterFirebaseSendEmailVerification.description: You can pass state via a continue URL when sending email actions for verifying a user's email.This provides the user the ability to go back to the app after the action is completed. In addition, you can specify whether to handle the email action link directly from a mobile application when it is installed instead of a web page.

GetXMasterFirebaseEmailVerification Snip.description: The code then can be received in app by parsing the Firebase Dynamic Link. Refer - Handling email actions in a mobile application to know how to handle the link in app. You can use firebase_dynamic_links flutter package to get the oobCode from the link and apply actionCode as follow.

GetXMasterController With State Mixin Sn.description: Generate GetController with statemixin and oninit.

// if you need to call something outside the builder method.
onChanged: data, // Rx has a _callable_ function! You could use (flag) => data.value = flag,
final Map<String, dynamic> data = new Map<String, dynamic>();
final Map<String, dynamic> data = new Map<String, dynamic>();
Future<Response> postUser(Map data) => post('http://youapi/users', body: data);

GetFinal_ Snippet.description: Generate fully final, get and setter private.

GetFinal Snippet.description: Generate simple final obs, get and setter.

GetList Snippet.description: Generates a ListView with GetX widget, fully functional.

GetListDismissible Snippet.description: Generates a ListView with GetX and Dismissible widget, fully functional.

GetButton Snippet.description: Generates a Standard RaisedButtom with its attributes.

GetButtonWidget Snippet.description: Generate a stateless class with a RaisedButton that can be reused by more than one widget.

GetFAB Snippet.description: Generates a Standard FloatingActionButton with its attributes.

GetFABWidget Snippet.description: Generate a stateless class with a FloatingActionButton that can be reused by more than one widget.

GetForm Snippet.description: Generate a Form Widget with getx components.

GetXMasterSmartPut Snippet.description: Smart dependency injection with conditional logic. Parameters: builder (required), condition (optional), validityCheck (optional), tag (optional), permanent (default: false), fenix (default: false). Example: smartPut<DatabaseService>(builder: () => DatabaseService(), condition: () => NetworkManager.isConnected).

GetXMasterSmartPutIf Snippet.description: Advanced smart dependency injection with fallback support. Parameters: primaryCondition (required), builder (required), secondaryValidation (optional), fallbackBuilder (optional), tag (optional), permanent (default: false), enableLogging (default: false). Example: smartPutIf<UserService>(primaryCondition: () => AuthManager.isLoggedIn, builder: () => UserService(), fallbackBuilder: () => GuestUserService()).

GetXMasterLazyManage Snippet.description: Lazy dependency management with optional initialization condition. Parameters: builder (required), initCondition (optional), tag (optional), permanent (default: false). Example: lazyManage<ExpensiveService>(builder: () => ExpensiveService(), initCondition: () => FeatureFlags.isServiceEnabled).

GetXStorage Has Data.description: Check if a key exists in GetXStorage

GetXStorage Listen.description: Listen to all changes in GetXStorage

GetXStorage Listen Key.description: Listen to changes of a specific key in GetXStorage

GetXStorage Change Value.description: Change the value of a key in GetXStorage

GetXStorage Write If Null.description: Write data only if the key doesn't exist in GetXStorage

GetXStorage Initialization.description: Initialize GetXStorage in the main function

GetXStorage Custom Container.description: Create a custom container in GetXStorage
